content: caracol button hat by kaity fraker materials 60 yards super-bulky yarn - sample shown knit with malabrigo caracol us size 13 needles us size 15 16 circular needles 4 stitch markers one a different color than the rest large button scissors yarn needle gauge approx 9 stitches = 4 in stockinette stitch finished size 20 in circumference pattern using size 13 needles co 50 stitches knit 10 row flat next row with size 15 16 circular needle bind off first 6 stitches knit to end 44 stitches place a beginning-of-round marker the different colored one and join to work in round knit in stockinette stitch knit every round until piece measures 6 5 from cast on on last round place other 3 markers after the 11th 22nd and 33rd stitch begin decreasing as follows decrease round *k 1 ssk k to 2 stitches before next marker k2tog repeat from * to end of round repeat decrease round until 3 stitches remain between each marker next round *k1 k2tog repeat from * to end of round 8 stitches remain cut yarn and draw through remaining stitches weave in ends on wrong side attach button on button flap
